serviceName: Content Robustness and Integrity Evaluation Service
description: A synthetic evaluation suite designed to measure the resilience, factual accuracy, and clarity of system-generated claims against neutral, mechanical data perturbations.

governance.auditMandate: Synthetic, aggregate metrics only. No individual agent state reporting.

modules.moduleDescription: Applies statistically defined, reversible, mechanical distortions (e.g., blur, token drop, translation cycles) to source text to test robustness and comprehension stability.

source_claim.description: The factual or instructional text block to be tested for resilience.

operations.description: Parameters defining the type and intensity of neutral noise applied.

token_drop.description: Probability (0.0 - 1.0) of dropping random non-essential tokens/words.

translation_rounds.description: Sequential back-and-forth translations (e.g., English to Japanese to English) to test context loss.

synonym_swap.description: Probability (0.0 - 1.0) of replacing low-frequency words with common synonyms.

outputMetrics.description: Measures semantic overlap between original and recovered claim (Comprehension Loss).
Measures change in readability after distortion and recovery.

modules.moduleDescription: Creates structured counter-examples and checks the logical consistency and conflict resolution stability of the tested model.

assertions.description: List of factual or procedural assertions to be tested for logical consistency (e.g., ['A orbits B', 'B orbits A']).

sources.description: List of authorized, trusted URIs to be used for initial factual validation.

outputMetrics.description: Confirms contradictory assertions are correctly flagged as mutually exclusive (True/False).
Ratio of model confidence between contradictory claims (checks reasoning stability).
Percentage of assertions that can be linked to verified sources.
